overview: Felipe Camposano also serves as Strategic Planning Chair for the ASEM-BIO (The Chilean Biotechnology Association). He currently holds board seats at Lucien Biotech (which he co-founded), and at the Agro Biotech Center of DICTUC, the technology transfer arm of Universidad Católica de Chile. Prior to joining Austral, Felipe directed New Business Development at Fundación Chile where he created and invested in new technology companies. Felipe was founder and CEO of INTRA, delivering enterprise knowledge management solutions to Global 1000 firms and was co-founder of NEXION, providing technology development services to Latin American companies in China. He has served as consultant and advisor at CORFO-Invest and ProChile, promoting international investment in Chile; new project valuation at OPS&S in Argentina, Brazil and Chile; and technology advisor to CORFO-Innova, the Chilean Development Agency. Filipe has taught the Technology Entrepreneur Marketing course at Universidad Católica de Chile, written the investor column at BioNexa (RedCiencia) and won national and international innovation awards for his patents (PCT/IB2007/050917). Felipe holds a BSc. in Computer Sciences and a MSc. in Industrial Engineering from Universidad Católica de Chile.
